title: 2024 OTN CBS, GUL, SIA, and HFX VR4 Receiver Offloads
comment:
A Liquid Robotics SV3 v300 Wave Glider was deployed with a towed Innovasea VM4-WG with the ability to offload Innovasea VR4 acoustic receivers. The glider was also equipped with an Airmar 200WX weather station and Liquid Robotics GPSWaves wave height sensor mounted to masts on top of the float, Airmar DX900+ water speed sensor mounted forward thru-hull and two Innovasea VMTs mounted to the front of the sub assembly with one hydrophone head pointed up, one hydrophone head pointed down. 

The glider will offload VR4 receivers in the OTN Cabot Strait, Gully, Sable Island, and Halifax Lines respectively.

deployment_details.deployment_personnel: Tyler Byrne, Matt Mar, Maggie Folkins

raw_relationship.comment: SBE43F integrated with Glider Payload CTD SN 0069

instrument.comment:
Pumped CTD with optional SBE 43F dissolved oxygen sensor. Mounted under float of wave glider.

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1026/

DO 43F - 43-3801
PUMP - 6853

sensor.comment:
600m depth limit, plastic housing.

Sea-Bird polarographic membrane sensor (fast response) for SBE Integrated CTD-DO profilers. Temperature-compensated oxygen signal is a frequency output.

Serviced by Sea-Bird Dec 2019.
Configured to use Sea-Bird equations (2007 and later):

Calibration Coefficients:
Soc = 3.1429e-004
Foffset = -833.7971
A = -3.5379e-003
B = 1.6218e-004
C = -2.7063e-006
D0 = 2.5826e+000
D1 = 1.92634e-004
D2 = -4.64803e-002
E = 3.6000e-002
Tau20 = 1.0400
H1 = -3.3000e-002
H2 = 5.0000e+003
H3 = 1.4500e+003

instrument.comment:

instrument.comment: MAP-114, ID: 13885, Never Tx

raw_data.title: 2024 OTN CBS, GUL, SIA, and HFX VR4 Receiver Offloads
raw_data.comment:
A Liquid Robotics SV3 v300 Wave Glider was deployed with a towed Innovasea VM4-WG with the ability to offload Innovasea VR4 acoustic receivers. The glider was also equipped with an Airmar 200WX weather station and Liquid Robotics GPSWaves wave height sensor mounted to masts on top of the float, Airmar DX900+ water speed sensor mounted forward thru-hull and two Innovasea VMTs mounted to the front of the sub assembly with one hydrophone head pointed up, one hydrophone head pointed down. 

The glider will offload VR4 receivers in the OTN Cabot Strait, Gully, Sable Island, and Halifax Lines respectively.

3MPU for SV3-1070. Ports for: Debug, GPSWaves, RUDICS, GPCTD+DO, C3 pump, C3 sensor, ADCP, Expansion

SMC port forwarding currently set-up for port 30022

SMC software version 2.7.0 (as of July 2021)

instrument.comment:
LRI GPSWaves software receives selected inputs from: the 1Hz GPS included with the Wave Glider system and a LORD Microstrain GPS-Aided Inertial Navigation System (GPS/INS) device.

LORD Microstrain serial number: 6251-4220.102126

raw_relationship.comment: Tracker SN-1240 was installed on SV3-1121 for the 2024 Offloads mission.

instrument.long_name: Xeos Rover Iridium Based Surface Beacon
instrument.comment:
IMEI: 300434063188950

Operating temperature -40 to +60 degC

raw_relationship.comment: Mounted on the tip of starboard tail fin of the Towfish. Hydrophone head pointed forward. Photos included in 2024 Offloads platform deployment documentation.

instrument.comment: MAP-114, ID: 13885, Never Tx
